meta.title: Get All Scripts - Scripts - Scripts - Management APIs - API Reference
meta.description:
Returns a list of Scripts. Optional parameters can be passed in.

This operation will only return scripts generated by the API key and password used to ...

blocks.data:
Returns a list of *Scripts*. Optional parameters can be passed in.

This operation will only return scripts generated by the API key and password used to create the script originally.

### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Content | modify | `store_v2_content` |
|  Content | read-only | `store_v2_content_read_only` |

**Note:**: Injecting scripts into Checkout requires `Checkout Content` scope.

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication). 
* **Name**: X-Auth-Token
* **Location**: header

page.description: Specifies the page number in a limited (paginated) list of products.

limit.description: Controls the number of items per page in a limited (paginated) list of products.

sort.description: Field name to sort the scripts by. Note: Since `id` increments when new scripts are added, you can use that field to sort by script create date.

channel_id:in.description: Filters list of scripts by the associated channel_id.

allOf.title: script_Base
allOf.description: Script properties common to `post`, `put`, and `get` requests.

html.description: An html string containing exactly one `script` tag. Only present if `kind` is `script_tag`.

src.description: The `src` attribute of the script to load. Only present if `kind` is `src`.

auto_uninstall.description: It will enable automatic cleanup of the script when the single click app is uninstalled or OAuth token is revoked.

load_method.description: The load method to use for the script. Values are `default`, `async`, or `defer`. It determines how the script should be loaded into the page.

location.description: Where on the page to place the script. Values are `head` or `footer`.

visibility.description:
Which set of pages the script should load on. 

Please note that you need to have `Checkout content` scope to use `all_pages` and `checkout`.

- The current visibility options are `storefront`, `checkout`, `all_pages` and `order_confirmation`.

     `storefront`: All pages that are not `checkout` or `order_confirmation`.
		 
For a list of all locations visit [Scripts Visibility](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/storefront/scripts-overview#scripts_scripts-visibility).

kind.description:
What type of script this is.

`src` - a `script` tag will be generated with its `src` attribute set to the value of `src`; For scripts that use the src url. By providing a path to the script, we can optimize and serve the script tag automatically for you.

`script_tag` - The value of `html` will be injected directly onto the page.
For scripts which include a raw HTML script_tag to be inserted into the page. The load_method must be default.

api_client_id.description: The client id of the API user that created this script, or blank if created by other means.

consent_category.description: Consent category for GDPR and CCPA compliance. Defaults to `uknown` when not specified. Scripts with an `uknown` consent category do not display on stores with customer cookie consent banners enabled.

enabled.description: Indicates whether a script is enabled.

meta.description: Data about the response, including pagination and collection totals.

pagination.description: Data about the response, including pagination and collection totals.
pagination.title: Pagination

total.description: Total number of items in the result set.

count.description: Total number of items in the collection response.

per_page.description: The amount of items returned in the collection per page, controlled by the limit parameter.

current_page.description: The page you are currently on within the collection.

total_pages.description: The total number of pages in the collection.

links.description: Pagination links for the previous and next parts of the whole collection.

previous.description: Link to the previous page returned in the response.

current.description: Link to the current page returned in the response.

next.description: Link to the next page returned in the response.
